conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the system and use equilibrium conditions to determine F1 and F2.
The object of mass m is suspended at point D by a light rope.
The light rings E and F can move freely along rods OA and OB, respectively.
The angle between rods OA (vertical) and OB is 45 degrees.
The object is in equilibrium, meaning the net force acting on it is zero.
At point D, the following forces act: the weight of the object W = mg, the tension in the rope connected to ring E as force F1, and the tension in the rope connected to ring F as force F2.
Resolve forces into components: F1 has no horizontal component, vertical component F1y = F1.
Resolve forces into components: F2 has horizontal component F2x = F2/sqrt(2) and vertical component F2y = F2/sqrt(2).
Resolve forces into components: Weight W = mg acts vertically downward as Wy = mg.
Apply horizontal equilibrium condition: F2x = F2/sqrt(2) = 0.
